  11. Bombardment Round: Regrettably, this leaves the galactic capitol exposed to the Alien Player Cruiser. It rolled a 7 (miss >5)

stages.heading: Stardate 2415.9 (The Rematch for the Galactic Capitol)
stages.commentary:
Pulling our Battleship out of the battle allowed it to regain its strength... at the expense of the last Cruiser also regaining its strength. We will have a rematch this turn.

  1. Round 1: 1 Battleship versus 1 Cruiser. Next frag wins!
  2. Our Battleship (3 HP) has rolled a 1 (≤5 to hit). Their Cruiser (1 HP left) rolled a 10 (≤3 to hit)

  3. Round 2: Our Battleship has rolled a 3 (≤5 to hit), scoring the finishing hit! It has then rolled a 5 for experience (failure >4)

stages.heading: Stardate 2416.0
stages.commentary:
We may be able to close out this playthrough 3 turns from now... depending on where the 55 CP gets spent, protection-wise. We buy Military Academy 1 (-15) + Ship Size 6 (-20), followed 1 Battlecruiser (-15) + 1 Ship Yard (-6) at G8, 2 Minesweepers (-12) + 2 Destroyers (-18) + 1 Ship Yard (-6) at D9.

{prodTable}{techTable}

For economic rolls, Prometheus rolled 1,3,5,8,8,10. Fleet launches are automatic. Prometheus instead rolled an 8 for extermination fleet, and got the galactic capitol as its random assignment.

stages.heading: Stardate 2416.2
stages.commentary: The push towards Terra now has a small secondary fleet coming in to sandwich the planet.

stages.heading: Stardate 2416.5 (The Battle for Sector G9)
stages.commentary:
Almost ready to pressure Terra... but we have a battle to resolve against one of our colonies first. Starting at the Military Academy step, Prometheus rolls a 9 (skip). On the Boarding step, they roll a 10 (also skip). On the Ship Size step, they roll a 2 (buy). Prometheus buys Ship Size 4 for 20 CP, spending all of their Tech bank. For fleet construction, we go straight to the largest ship step, which gives them a Battlecruiser (-15). For composition, they roll a 5 (Balanced). With only Attack 1, they build 2 Scouts (-12) to accompany their Battlecruiser; which spends all of their assigned money.

  1. Round 1: We have 2 ships. They have 3 ships. This could go either direction
  2. Our Battleship has the best weapon class, so we shoot first. We rolled a 7 against their Scouts (miss >6)
  3. Our Battlecruiser has the tactics advantage, so it shoots first. We rolled a 10 against their Scouts (miss >7)
  4. Their Battlecruiser shoots next. They rolled a 6 against our Battlecruiser (miss >4)
  5. Their 2 Scouts shoot at last. They rolled 1,7 against our Battlecruiser (1 hit ≤2), damaging it

  6. Round 2: Our Battleship shoots once more. We rolled a 5 against their Scouts (hit ≤6). We then rolled an 8 for experience (failure >2)
  7. Our Battlecruiser shoots next. We rolled a 9 against their Scouts (miss >7)
  8. Their Battlecruiser shoots once more. They rolled a 5 against our Battlecruiser (miss >4)
  9. Their 1 surviving Scout shoots also. They rolled a 9 against our Battlecruiser (1 hit ≤2), damaging it

  10. Round 3: Two to two. Our Battleship shoots once more. We rolled a 4 against their last Scout (hit ≤6). We then rolled a 10 for experience (failure >2)
  11. Our Battlecruiser shoots next. We rolled a 5 against their last ship (hit ≤6), damaging it
  12. Their Battlecruiser shoots once more. They rolled a 4 against our Battlecruiser (hit ≤4), finishing it off. They then rolled an 8 for experience (failure >4)

  13. Round 4: One to one. Next frag wins! (Assuming we do not retreat)
  14. Our Battleship rolled a 6 (miss >5). Their Battlecruiser rolled a 1 (hit ≤4), damaging our last ship to 2 HP

  15. Round 5: Our Battleship rolled a 2 (hit ≤5), finishing off their last ship. We then rolled an 8 for experience (failure >4)

stages.heading: Stardate 2416.8 (The Battle for Terra)
stages.commentary:
Now is the time to pile on every combat ship that was able to reach Terra! Their Fleet and Tech banks are already spent, so the only thing able to help them is the Protection and Expansion banks (55 CP total). Since this homeworld has plenty of compatible CP, it starts on the Heavy Infantry step. A 3 is rolled, buying that many Heavy Infantry for 9 CP. On the orbital protection step, a 10 was rolled (max Bases). 46 CP is good for 3 Bases (-36) + 2 Minelayers (-10).

  1. Space Round 1: Our 4 Minesweepers have swept whatever little ammunition their 2 Minelayers were able to lay. The final counts are 20 ships to their 4 Bases. We will screen our Transports each round (if able), and gain the Fleet Size Bonus
  2. Their 4 Bases have the best weapon class, so they shoot first. They rolled 7,9,6 against our 2 Destroyers (2 hits ≤7), eliminating that group. They then roll a 3 against our 2 Battlecruisers (hit ≤6), damaging one of them
  3. Our 2 Battlecruisers shoot next. Since they have only Bases, this makes rolls easy. We rolled 2,6 (2 hits ≤6), badly damaging one of them
  4. Our 1 Flagship shoots next, rolling a 2 (hit ≤5), finishing off one of them. Bases do not give experience, so we skip this step
  5. Our 8 Legendary Cruisers are finally ready to shoot. We rolled 2,2,4,5,6,8,10,10 (4 hits ≤5); destroying a second, and lightly damaging a third

  6. Space Round 2: We have 18 ships to their 2 Bases
  7. Their 2 surviving Bases shoot once more. They rolled 1,5 against our 2 Battlecruisers (2 hits ≤6), cleanly destroying one of them
  8. Our 1 surviving Battlecruiser shoots next, rolling a 6 (hit ≤6), badly damaging the third Base
  9. Our 1 Flagship shoots next, rolling a 10 (miss >5)
  10. Our 8 Legendary Cruisers are finally ready to shoot. We rolled 1,4,4,4,6,9,9,9 (4 hits ≤5); finishing off their Bases exactlye

  11. Bombardment Round: Our 1 Battlecruiser has the first shot at bombarding, rolling a 7 (hit ≤7), damaging Terra to 15 CP
  12. Our 1 Flagship and 8 Cruisers have the same Attack rating, so we will conduct their bombardment rolls together. We rolled 1,9,9,2 (2 hits ≤6); stopping the process at 5 CP in income

  13. Ground Round 1: Our Transports have unloaded the 11 Space Marines that were in their cargo holds
  14. Their 3 Heavy Infantry shoot first, rolling 1,8,9 (1 hit ≤5), damaging one of our units
  15. Their 5 Militia also shoot, rolling 4,5,7,9,10 (1 hit ≤4), finishing off one of our units

stages.commentary:
Terra has been captured! Since this was the last Alien Player homeworld that fell, we believe that concludes this scenario in victory.

We had a suspenseful mid-game, when Epimetheus' initial momentum threatened to end the scenario by capturing Abydos (G8) and securing the final 3 VP. When their momentum ran out, their VP started declining once we started capturing planets. Perhaps we might need to be more aggressive when running out of unexplored home systems to explore, should we step it up to Normal difficulty.
